programme.desc: On a busy platform at a train station in Bologna in 2012, a jealous husband shocked commuters by pulling out a knife on his estranged wife's lover.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 2001 matchup between the D-backs and the Yankees. New York took a 3-2 series lead but strong pitching and a late-inning comeback in Game 7 led Arizona to knock off the defending champs securing the World Series title.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The first-ever World Series matchup between two Wild Card teams lived up to the "wild" name, as the Angels survived Barry Bonds and a 3-2 series deficit to take home their first World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: "The Marlins stun the Yankees and win their second World Series title, four games to two.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The Chicago White Sox put to rest 88 years of unfulfilled championship hopes when they swept past the gritty Houston Astros to capture the 2005 World Series.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The Cardinals would enter the 2006 World Series as proverbial underdogs, with the worst record of any playoff team that year. Under the fall lights, St. Louis would show that they were not a team to sleep on.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Boston waited 86 years for the Red Sox to break the "Curse of the Bambino" and end its World Series title drought in 2004. It took just three years for the team to win another.

programme.desc: Brad Lidge closed out the Rays and a perfect season as Harry Kalas declared "The Philadelphia Phillies are 2008 World Champions of baseball".

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client enlists Dave on a mission from God to make his dreams of a father/son road trip along Route 66 come true; getting the client's mechanically unsound reproduction of the Bluesmobile ready for the road will test the crew's mettle.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A longtime customer has his eye set on a car from Joe's personal collection, a 1967 Nova; Joe counters by offering up a 1966 Nova, with the guarantee that it will be twice the car Joe's is; big brakes, big power, big wheels and more.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show to the Midwest, as more than 2,500 cars descend on the Summit Motorsports drag strip for a weekend of fun; Kev gets a ride in a lean, mean drag racing machine; Dave steps up his autocross game.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cars die of boredom, so it wasn't great for a Plymouth Prowler to sit in a museum for 15 years; the girls show what areas to fix before the car gets back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings back the 442 Tribute car to give it a new LS engine and finish modifying the interior for the previously-installed TKO transmission.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Some project cars need every body panel replaced, so Fuller and Bumpus show how to work with new sheet metal panels on a 1963 Impala; they also find a running Road Runner to have some fun with.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller brings in a twin-turbo, thousand-horsepower Cutlass to do some custom fabrication and build an all-new interior.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Putting a twin-turbo Cummins into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo is a monster build unlike any other for 1 Way Diesel Performance. YouTube's "Unspeakable" star Nathan Graham asks Mod Mafia to help him out of a jam with his all-terrain, amphibious SHERP.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The 1991 Land Rover Defender is known for ruggedness and simplicity; Mod Mafia does a reboot of a tired, old Defender with modern performance, power and custom luxury; Wide Open Garage takes an old-school Bronco monster truck into overdrive.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Social media star Liver King not only wants Mod Mafia to beef up his prized 2001 H1 Hummer's performance, he wants to customize it for his primal lifestyle; the team at Wide Open Garage must build a custom off-road truck completely from scratch.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Wide Open Garage's mega-truck build gets even bigger as they take an old-school '82 C10 square body and create a one-of-one show truck, monster truck; one Way Diesel Performance lives up to their name by giving an '88 Silverado more than 1,200 horsepower.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi finds an M-3 BMW she wants to buy for herself; the AGG Team will need to rebuild the brakes, bleed the clutch, install a new radiator and rework the front-end with new headlights.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The AGG team takes a Scat Pack Challenger and adds a prototype twin turbo kit; the team then beefs up the rear-end with new axles.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jarod decides to build a custom titanium exhaust for a 1,400 horsepower Supra.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou relive their childhoods while working on a pair of '80s Grand Nationals; one vehicle receives new brakes and full coil-over suspension, while the other gets a new interior.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian doesn't like spending money on new trucks, so he just builds what he wants; today, he starts working on a custom frame to sit under a classic Jeepster Commando and outfits the suspension, along with getting new one-ton axles underneath.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian brings in a 1968 M715 to make it more reliable; he takes the body off the original chassis and stretches a Jeep JK chassis to make it fit; he adds upgraded suspension, 1-ton axles and an LS engine to make it a truck that can fight any battle.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye describe a common failure problem on a fifth-generation Camaro. The torque converter can fail in the transmission, causing the car to shake at 40-50 mph. The girls upgrade the factory torque converter to fix this problem for good.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Four gears are better than two, so the crew takes the old two-speed Powerglide out of a '67 Chevy Camaro and installs a Muncie four speed.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys bring in a vintage 1979 Jeep that is being sent to auction to give it a finished interior with carpet and panels; Jeremy uses a sewing machine to bind the carpet edges.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Jeremy take a first-generation Scout apart and put an all-new chassis, drive train and 4-link suspension underneath.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The Budget TJ gets some more parts; Ian updates the suspension with new coilovers; he adds new bumpers front and rear, and by the end of the day, this TJ is trail ready.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black

programme.title: Head 2 Head

programme.title: Super Turbo Story Time

programme.title: Loyalty 2 the Return of T Bone
programme.desc: After making bail, the notorious killer and drug lord T Bone returns to the streets of Harlem, NY to clean up the family business and tie all loose ends. But once again the tables are turned when T Bone is betrayed by someone close.

programme.title: Mr. Hit Me Up

programme.title: Conflict of Interest
programme.desc: When Mickey (Christopher McDonald) returns to the police force after a long hiatus, he has his sights set on shady businessman Gideon (Judd Nelson). Everyone knows that Gideon peddles drugs and sex and sells stolen cars. When Mickey's son, Jason (Gregory Alan Harris), is framed for murder, Mickey is set to prove that Gideon is behind it all. In his search for justice and revenge, Mickey is willing to do anything, and he's determined to shut Gideon down forever.

programme.title: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
programme.desc: The last job of Calvary Captain Nathan Brittles (John Wayne) before retirement is to soothe relations with the Cheyenne and Arapaho Indians after Custer's last stand. At the same time, he must transport the wife (Mildred Natwick) and niece (Joanne Dru) of his commanding officer to a safe destination. After both his missions stall, Brittles attempts a face-to-face meeting with an important Native American chief in order to stave off an impending war.

programme.title: Fort Apache
programme.desc: When arrogant and stubborn Civil War hero Lieutenant Colonel Owen Thursday (Henry Fonda) arrives in Arizona with his daughter, Philadelphia (Shirley Temple), to assume command of the Fort Apache outpost, he clashes with level-headed Captain Kirby York (John Wayne). Viewing the local Native Americans through an ignorantly negative lens, Thursday is determined to engage them in battle for his own glory, despite the warnings of York -- an act of folly that will have dire consequences.

programme.title: Zorro
programme.desc: Zorro must stop Don Carlos as he tries, once again, to capture the mountain man.

programme.desc: A prospector freed from prison reacquaints himself with his son.

programme.desc: Belle Starr (Jane Russell), a voluptuous outlaw, is lying low in a small desert town with Bob Dalton (Scott Brady) and his feckless bank robber brothers. When wealthy saloon keeper Tom Bradfield (George Brent) takes a liking to her, Belle reassesses her options and considers playing the men against each another. Knowing that Tom wants to get Bob out of the picture, she leads one suitor on a crime spree against the other while puzzling through her complicated romances.

programme.desc: Life in a fictional Tombstone in the 1880s.

programme.title: Bat Masterson

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat tries to help Clyde Richards negotiate the purchase of an old mining road to create a route through the mountains, but when Bat recognizes the holdout owner from his past, the mission takes a dark turn.

programme.desc: When a woman arrives in North Fork with symptoms of smallpox, Lucas, Lou Mallory, Doctor Burrage and hotel occupants are quarantined in the hotel with an outlaw.

programme.desc: Pahoo is accused of an assassination attempt on the General Custer and taken into custody. Custer disregards Yancy's explanation that the weapons are from a different tribe than Pahoo's Pawnee. Meanwhile, Yancy discovers that he is being stalked by a Native American seeking revenge for a past wrong.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: When Mississippi riverboats sink in record numbers, Yancy investigates if these shipwrecks are an act of sabotage. He joins aboard the Southern Belle, owned by a fiery redhead, which ends up being the latest victim in a suspicious string of wrecks. Yancy finds a connection between the murder of Charlie Webster and a dispatch key belonging to a ship pilot.

programme.desc: The Lone Ranger and Tonto set a trap for outlaws posing as members of the cavalry.

programme.desc: The year is 1878, and the young daughter of a U.S. general is kidnapped and taken far into the Apache lands of the Arizona Territory. Prospector Ward Kinsman (Robert Taylor) is enlisted to find the girl because he knows the area well. Though Ward is initially skeptical of the dangerous task, he changes his tune when he finds out that the captive's gorgeous sister, Ann (Arlene Dahl), will be coming along. Unfortunately, their mission and potential romance is soon interrupted by an Apache attack.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: The Lone Ranger and Tonto search for three brothers who have escaped from prison.

programme.desc: The Lone Ranger and Tonto attempt to restore order in a town plagued by murders, lynchings and rustling.

programme.desc: An ambitious housekeeper plans to get control of an elderly rancher's vast estate.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim Bowie takes a detour on a trip home from Christmas when a thief steals the gift he was taking to his mother. In pursuit, he lands on a plantation where he is mistaken for someone.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: When a renegade American, now a Mexican Army officer, plots to kill Bowie because he?s a friend of Sam Houston, Bowie is detained on pretext of lacking a passport to Texas.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim Bowie encounters a bear and must flee for his life, the event which inspired the first Bowie knife to be made.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim Bowie gives an arrogant Southern belle a lesson in manners and wins her sympathy for an impoverished immigrant family.

programme.desc: A magician teaches Pancho some magic tricks. Cisco and his pal have to discover who killed the sheriff.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho try to find a girl's missing uncle.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho are being impersonated by two bandits who have committed robbery and murder, so they have to break jail to prove their innocence.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho are asked by Marshal Ben Lane to track down a gang of counterfeiters. Cisco suspects the local banker and his clerk to be involved in the counterfeit but cannot prove anything.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: An evil medicine man holds the tribe's chief captive while plotting a new Indian war against the territory's ranchers.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: Ricky and Sandy persuade a railroad line to bypass the range where Champion and his remuda live.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: Mary Jane, Ricky's young neighbor, is upset when she learns that Uncle Andrew, her newly appointed guardian, plans to sell the ranch she lives on and force her to move East with him.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: An ex-convict trying to go straight and his pretty wife buy the ranch next to the North's. He has a chance meeting with his former gang members who threaten his wife if he doesn't cooperate.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: When a Indian chief who has just returned to his tribe is framed for murder, Ricky and Sandy try to prove his innocence before this followers go on the warpath.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: An outlaw who has escaped from custody joins his old gang and plans his next robbery - a rich bank that's not too far away.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: Rebel is hurt by a porcupine and Ricky gets help for him from a new southern doctor who just arrived in town.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy is up against a phony European "baron" and his gang of horse thieves who have come to buy horses from a desperate Colonel.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: After an outlaw escapes from a stagecoach hold-up killing, Claibourne spearheads a drive in Tombstone to raise a reward for his capture; two shady bounty hunters plan to get the reward.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: After Sam Brewster's son gets shot in self defense by Deputy Charlie, only Curly Bill Brocius decides to stand with the sheriff when they meet Brewster's men at the outskirts of town.

programme.title: Bat Masterson

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: The owner of a casino in Paradise, Colo., refuses to pay the debts and taxes he owes, prompting Bat's appointment to the role of county tax assessor.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Gunslinger Johnny Drako rides into town and tells the bartender that he is looking for Lucas McCain. After Johnny leaves the saloon, Sweeney hurries to tell Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman

Yancy arranges for photographer Mathew Brady and pickpocket Jody Barker to help him with a scheme to raise money for Elsie's children.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: When renegades attack peaceful Pawnee villages, Pahoo, Yancy and Colorado Charlie travel to Washington, D.C. with John Colton's letter of introduction in an attempt to enforce the terms of the Tablecreek Treaty made with the tribe. programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley has just ridden into the town of Yellow Jacket, when he sees a gunman unhitching a team of horses over the loud objections of a pretty woman.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: A crooked gambler with a Kentucky-born thoroughbred prods a drunken rancher into betting his entire spread and all the money he has in the bank on a horse race.

programme.desc: Two pranksters write away for a mail-order bride, using Lucas's name.

programme.desc: Lucas recognizes Dr. Battle as an ex-gunslinger with whom he once fought. He helps with a dying man, but Lucas and the doctor have unresolved anger.

programme.desc: Mark takes a job as a stable boy against his father's wishes.

programme.desc: Mark and Milly are held hostage in her general store when two gunmen attempt a daring robbery.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark goes to work for Will Temple, a badly scarred, very mysterious rancher.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Corey Hazlett insists he's innocent of murder, despite Lucas's eyewitness testimony.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Abe Lincoln's claim that he's the Great Emancipator amuses everyone except Matt Yordy.

programme.desc: Stubborn Grandpa Fogarty is Lucas's main roadblock as he tries to get young Woody Fogarty to attend school.

programme.desc: Lucas tries to stop embittered John Holliver from venting his wrath on the people who expelled him from town years before.

programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mary is devastated that Halloween has been canceled by the city, so Darlene and Becky enlist Jackie and the rest of the family to create an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene isolates herself from her co-workers at Wellman Plastics, leaving them with the impression she is an elitist snob.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Beverly Rose's first birthday -- but it's not all cake and candles -- when Becky and Emilio disagree on what kind of party they should have.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene's friendship with a manager at Wellman Plastics lands her in an awkward situation; Louise's brother tries to win over Jackie.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: In an effort to save money, Darlene and Ben, and Jackie and Neville head off on their joint honeymoon, where their cost-saving measures contribute to a tension-filled getaway.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Jackie moves in with Neville, he shows up to their home with an excess of animals from his vet office; Darlene and Ben argue Darlene is turning into her father.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie must come to terms with her mother becoming ill; Darlene's job hunt proves to be more difficult than anticipated.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.desc: Darlene continues her search for a new job; Becky is desperate to spend more time with Beverly Rose.

programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.title: The Carol Burnett Show
programme.desc: John Byner and Petula Clark head downtown to the show. Along with classic characters ("The Old Folks" and Alice Portnoy), TV commercial spoofs and the firing of Donald Duck (Byner) are on tap tonight.

programme.title: The Carol Burnett Show
programme.desc: Jim Nabors returns for his eleventh and final season premiere guest star spot! Also featured: new cast member Dick Van Dyke joins Tim for a pantomime sketch about workmen installing windows.

programme.desc: ALF befriends a young Mexican immigrant.

programme.title: ALF
programme.desc: ALF goes through a 24-hour period of bizarre behavior.

programme.desc: A thirsty husband suffers the effects of his wife's salty ham; a gunfighter runs a concession stand; a guy in an alley tells the story of a modern day hero.

programme.title: The Carol Burnett Show

programme.desc: ALF develops a gambling habit and winds up in trouble with his bookie.

programme.desc: Brian causes trouble at school when he repeats some of ALF's intergalactic knowledge.

programme.desc: The Thirty Helens and the apathetic cop; a kid brings home a stray businessman; Mark and Bruce sing a song about a folk hero.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues at Ann's Farmhouse in Thornton, Yorkshire, owned by Chris Foster, who's assisted by his good friend, Christel Richter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The R Inn in Desborough, owned by Kris Malde, who's helped out by events manager Vikki Cheetham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Stockton Mill B&B in Shropshire, where Stephen and Caroline Cox hope to provide a home from home for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Duxford Lodge in Cambridgeshire, run by ex-phone salesman Kevin Patel. He's hoping to turn his family-owned hotel into a 1940s inspired B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Riverside House Hotel in Mildenhall, where experienced hoteliers Ged Sharrocks and Suzanne Law offer a full hotel experience helped by their staff.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Last to host are Stacey Walsham and Gemma Dyche from The Gate Hangs High in Hook Norton, Oxfordshire, where they hope their dog-friendly accommodation will go down a treat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Hampshire, at The Poacher Inn, where manager Nadia Schicci hopes her Italian directness and business approach will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Forest Country House in Powys, Wales, where owner Paul Martin, joined by best friend and neighbour, Jayne Kirk, hopes his luxury BandB will impress his guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to Fenwick, Scotland and Langside Bed and Breakfast, where high rolling, super clean hosts Debbie and Jim hope their business will wow the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the historic The Tushielaw Inn in Selkirk, Scotland, opened by Rab and Gail Forbes six months ago. Gail and Rab try to build bridges, but things take a downward turn.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Rooms 36 in The Lake District, owned by health-conscious Andy Peters, who is joined by friend and fellow B&B owner, Jeronime Palmer.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second hosts of the week are mother and son team Trish and Connor Richardson from the Red Lion Coaching Inn near Gainsborough.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Schiehallion Hotel in Aberfeldy, run by Julie Dunbar and James Graham. Some guests are impressed, but luxury lovers Andy and Jeronime are left wanting more.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Townhead Hotel in Lockerbie, owned by Stephen Montgomery and partner Jan. On arrival, the high level of finish in the rooms is a surprise for all of the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Stratford upon Avon at The Water's Edge Guest House, owner Julie Allison and friend Gerry Crabtree hope their luxurious approach and themed rooms will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Kilpeck Inn in Herefordshire where head chef Ross Williams and front of house manager Kath Capel consider no detail too small.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third stop is The Fox Inn in Guisborough where young hosts Michael Crane and Jai Bennison are determined to impress their guests with their straight-forward northern B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Ivanhoe Guest House, Bridlington, Mick and Gill Jennings think their simple approach will win the day. But at breakfast some serious allegations are made about the food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Falmouth in Cornwall, where Gaye Woods, owner of Meudon Hotel, hopes her family run hotel will win the day, but are her room rates too high?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Malborough in Devon and The Royal Oak pub, run by Tim Heap with help from his barman Mikey Martindale. Following some unwanted extras at breakfast, feedback is tough.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is in Tiverton in Devon and The Angel Guest House where owners Chris and Sue Holliday have created a homespun experience, but will they prove too competitive for the guests?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is The Compton Swan in Newbury, owned by Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan. Expectations are high after Joan reveals she was named Ireland's Business Woman of the Year.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Surf Hotel, Jeremy Mann and his Russian wife Elena hope their hands-off hosting style will win the day, despite the lack of breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London. Owner Robert Gray, an actor and antiques dealer, charms with his hosting, but Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Barn at Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, owned by Sarah Summers. Sarah is dreading Robert's arrival, but all the guests are bowled over.

programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where former IT consultant Gary Pesticcio and his daughter, Naomi, hope their high-tech B&B will power them to victory.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The ultimate guessing game kicks off with the first six undercover celebrity singers – PEACOCK, HIPPO, MONSTER, UNICORN, DEER and LION – facing off against one another in elaborate head-to-toe costumes. Host Nick Cannon joins panelists Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger and Robin Thicke as they attempt to guess WHO is the performer behind the mask. Between all twelve of the celebrity competitors on the show, they’ve amassed 65 Grammy nominations, 16 multi-Platinum albums, 16 Emmy nominations, nine Broadway shows, four stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and four Super Bowl titles. One singer will be eliminated each week, ultimately revealing his or her true identity. Hear them sing, get the clues and guess the celebrity.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The second group of six undercover celebrity singers take the stage: RABBIT, ALIEN, RAVEN, PINEAPPLE, POODLE and BEE. programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the 'Legends Special' with all of the worst but funniest competitors from the last three series.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Beams and Jets, Donut Swing, Big Balls, a Potato Sack, and Barrel Crossing are just some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Some of the obstacles the contestants face are the “Bouncy Balls” and “The Sweeper”.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: 20 fabulous contestants travel halfway across the globe to the purpose-built course in Buenos Aires.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Time again for the world of celebrity to take on the most outrageous obstacle course in the name of charity.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond presents the annual Total Wipeout trophy-athon.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: 20 contestants take on four gruelling courses to win the title of Wipeout Champion.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty foolhardy Brits attempt to conquer the purpose-built obstacle course in Argentina.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the 'Legends Special' with all of the worst but funniest competitors from the last three series.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the second 'Celebrity Special' of the season.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Log Roll, Wall Swing, The Ring, Tippy Tables, and Cylinder Run are among the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, the North of the country takes on the South in a battle to win the coveted trophy.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond presents the annual Total Wipeout trophy-athon.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: 20 ordinary Canadians will compete in the world’s largest most extreme obstacle course designed to provide the most spills, thrills and fantastic fumbles ever seen on television.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: It's time for 'The Final' of 'Total Wipeout' season 2.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Total Wipeout is back with this exciting last season!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Ordinary British folk fly halfway across the world to test their endurance and bouncability in Argentina.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, contestants face different games like Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard's co-host Amanda Byram is course-side in Buenos Aires as 20 Brits tackle the Argentinian course.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Reigning champion Shaun O'Neale returns to the MASTERCHEF kitchen, as he chooses ingredients from his new cookbook to be part of the mystery box challenge.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 12 head to Sin City for a team challenge during which they will serve 50 VIPs in entertainment and hospitality at Caesars Palace for its 50th Anniversary party.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the exciting Season Finale, the two finalists will compete head-to-head and prepare the most important menu of their young lives. Find out which talented junior home cook will earn the MASTERCHEF trophy and a $100,000 prize.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: On the new “Junior Edition” of MASTERCHEF, America’s top 24 junior home cooks will enter the kitchen for the first time and jump right into their first mystery box challenge. Each junior home cook is tasked with preparing a signature burger and one side. The winner of the challenge will have a significant advantage and will select the main ingredient that the remaining contestants must use in the season’s first elimination round. The junior home cooks with the best dishes will advance in the competition.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to visit Hot Potato Cafe. He finds an owner sapped of passion who has created a toxic environment filled with negativity.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: While in New Jersey, Chef Ramsay visits Flamango's, an outdated eatery in need of help. Ramsay suggests a major overhaul, but the owner thinks it's best to simply shut down the restaurant.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The teams must create an ethnic dish in 45 minutes including a protein of their choice. The winners go on a shopping spree at a boutique and receive a set of copper-clad cookware.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The remaining chefs participate in a challenge that tests their skills at identifying foods merely by touch. The winners eat seafood at Malibu's Nobu restaurant.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Reigning champion Shaun O'Neale returns to the MASTERCHEF kitchen, as he chooses ingredients from his new cookbook to be part of the mystery box challenge.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 12 head to Sin City for a team challenge during which they will serve 50 VIPs in entertainment and hospitality at Caesars Palace for its 50th Anniversary party.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: On the next episode of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR, Season Two winner Logan returns to the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR kitchen and offer some advice to the remaining contestants. The top three contestants from the previous elimination challenge will compete in a cupcake-frosting contest, during which only the winner can keep the judges safe from a sticky situation. Then, in the next challenge, the contestants will be tasked with making a scallop dish in order to move onto the next round in the competition.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 20 junior home cooks face an out-of-this-world Mystery Box challenge with special guest astronaut Tracy Dyson, during which they must prepare a unique dish that highlights a stellar ingredient. The one who rockets to the top will have a significant advantage in the elimination challenge, when the contestants will be tasked with creating a stunning and delicious fish dish in order to move onto the next round.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay journeys to Ridgewood, New Jersey to rejuvenate Bazzini, an Italian eatery hampered by sluggish service and a lackluster kitchen staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Mojito's, a Cuban eatery in Brooklyn. The owners purchased the restaurant as newlyweds, but they are now seven years into a crumbling marriage and business.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay rewards the chef who has made the greatest stride in the competition with immunity from elimination during the next dinner service, in which the contestants try to impress the judges.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay tests the remaining contestants' abilities to communicate with one another in a three-entrée relay race. The winners tour LA by helicopter and visit the King Gillette Ranch.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In this week’s skills test, The Top 11 are given a bag of live crawfish and will have to carefully cook them in order to extract the most meat possible. The six weakest cooks will go head-to-head in an elimination challenge, during which they will make a crawfish dish created by none other than Gordon Ramsay. Then, the Top 10 face a chicken-and-potato team challenge. Find out which contestants will be eliminated.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Gordon's Game Of Chicken

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: On the next episode of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR, the remaining 18 junior home cooks will face their first team challenge of the season and the first-ever MASTERCHEF JUNIOR team relay race. Each team must create a large serving of seven-layer dip. The team that completes the dip first will be safe from the next elimination challenge, and choose the smelly, wrinkly or spicy ingredients for that challenge. Find out who will smell their way to victory and who will dip lower in the competition.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining junior home cooks will party their way into the next team challenge when they leave the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR kitchen for the first time to cook at a birthday party for kids ages 8-13, as well as special guests, the Ramsay and Elliot children. The team that receives the most votes from the birthday party attendees will be safe from elimination, while the losing team will compete in the next pressure test and create the French dessert croquembouche.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Lido di Manhattan, an Italian joint with an unsightly kitchen and inexperienced owner. He is so horrified that he shuts the place down temporarily.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay drops by a French eatery and discovers that he and the head chef have similar culinary training. However, the chef is in denial about the poor quality of his restaurant's food.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Each chef has 45 minutes to use a pressure cooker to make a meal using one of five cheap cuts of meat — each hidden in a pressure cooker — and fashion the dish as a five-star entrée.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay devises a team of former "Hell's Kitchen" winners to challenge the remaining contestants. The two teams must wow Chef Ramsay with their signature dishes.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In this week’s mystery box challenge, the Top Nine must create a dish that is reminiscent of their favorite family breakfast, using Nutella as the key ingredient. The winner gets a huge advantage moving forward, leaving the rest of the chefs to pair up for a Mexican-themed tag team challenge. Then, the Top Eight head to Big Bear Lake to cook fresh fish. Find out which contestants will be eliminated.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are cooking their main courses and are all taking risks to try and win a place at the banquet. Danny Parker is trying to recreate the flavours of an American barbecue but the veteran chef is dubious about one of his ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. All the chefs are using unusual ingredients in their desserts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs from the north east must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver, and guest Judy Murray.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Scottish regional heats and returning chefs to the competition Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath battle ambitious newcomer Angela Malik for a place in the national finals. This time they are cooking their starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated and the veteran chef is expecting perfection from the fish course. Ally McGrath creates an inventive dish based on his summer memories of rock pooling in the River Tweed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Angela Malik is in her element cooking a tiffin box based on memories of summer picnics. Michael Bremner is taking a huge risk, and Ally is creating an inventive dish based on a summer barbeque.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Angela Malik is cooking a technically challenging dessert.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two Scottish chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver. They are joined by guest judge Gary Parsons.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Determined newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie take on returning chef Phil Carmichael for a place in the national finals. It's Phil's third time in the competition and this year he's determined to make it to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses. Paul Croasdale is trying to recreate the elegance of Wimbledon with luxury ingredients such as king crab and scallops.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the main course, all three chefs are cooking Welsh lamb in the hope of impressing the judge. Phil is taking a risk with barbecued lamb and in an attempt to elevate a humble barbecue to banquet level, he's serving it with many accompaniments.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges so all three chefs are feeling the pressure. Phil Carmichael creates a tennis ball dessert that combines two British classics, Eton mess and trifle.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two winning chefs from the Wales region must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges and guest judge Dan Bloxham, Wimbledon's Master of Ceremonies.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Pip Lacey's starter is a humorous take on the unpredictable British weather and features an unusual presentation. Ryan Simpson's dish represents an allotment complete with soil, while Nick Deverell-Smith's creation is a tribute to the precision cutting of Wimbledon's grass.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With the chefs hoping to impress, they each take risks. Pip Lacey combines lobster with strawberry in a tribute to strawberries and cream. Ryan Simpson's also using lobster in his recreation of a BBQ and has invented a technique to create his chips.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ryan Simpson hopes to elevate a ploughman's lunch into a gourmet affair, Pip Lacey pays tribute to an unusual Wimbledon icon, while Nick Deverell-Smith looks to celebrate a meat which he thinks is underused, venison.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges. Pip Lacey's pineapple dessert uses coriander. Nick Deverell-Smith also pays tribute to the pineapple, creating a dessert featuring a rice pudding made with couscous.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who've made it through cook their four courses again. They must impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest judge Jordanne Whiley, one of Britain's most successful wheelchair tennis players.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. Eddie is hoping to do better than last year, Joery is hoping to impress with a tribute to Richard Krajicek, and Tommy is creating a warm salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Joery Castel is combining mackerel and cucumber, and Tommy Heaney hopes his Murray Mound is a fitting tribute to Andy Murray's love of sushi. Eddie Attwell is creating five different strawberry elements to accompany the scallops in his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who have made it through cook their four courses again. They are hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver, who are joined by tennis's greatest entertainer, Mansour Bahrami.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With finals week ahead of them, judge Andi Oliver first summons the chefs to Wimbledon to take a look at where they could be cooking if they win. The judges are joined by guest judge Sue Barker, host of the Wimbledon coverage for more than 20 years.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but with some exceptionally high scoring dishes in the regional heats, each chef will need to deliver perfection in order to see off the competition. The judges are joined by guest judge Tim Henman.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. As the barbecues are fired up, all eight chefs are feeling the heat. The judges are joined by guest judge Gordon Reid.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is dessert day and with just one place remaining at the Wimbledon banquet, each chef is giving everything they have got. The judges are joined by guest judge Annabel Croft, former British number one and Junior Wimbledon champion.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale and the winning chefs must now cook their dishes at the banquet. Once in the kitchen, the chefs face the huge challenge of scaling up their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Competing for top spot are Danny Parker, head chef at Michelin starred `House of Tides' in Newcastle, who is back to try his luck in the competition again after being knocked out in the regional heat last year following a tense tie-break. He's taking on two newcomers: Dan Fletcher, protégé of Phil Howard, and now head chef at `Fenchurch' in the City of London, and David Coulson,who runs `Peace and Loaf' in Newcastle, which boasts 2 AA rosettes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course the chefs are all aiming for 10s with their unique fish dishes. David is celebrating a personal connection to the brief with his `My Cod I Bet Me Ma'am Has Seen Some Trotters', a tribute to his mum who has worked as a chiropodist. Dan's `For All Those Sleepless Nights' pays tribute to nightshift workers from the NHS with some bold but classic flavours while Danny's `Not All Superheroes Wear Capes' aims to give a taste of luxury to the hardworking staff.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dan pays tribute to an icon of modern nursing, Florence Nightingale, while Danny is inspired by the founder of the NHS, Aneurin Bevan. David's dish is dedicated to the air ambulance staff who saved the life of his fiancé, and he even takes a trip to meet one of them.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the chefs' last chance to impress and tensions are high. Dan takes a risk with an unusual combination of ewe's milk and bergamot while Danny is determined to pull out all the stops with his complex dessert `Aunty Gwen's Chocolate'. David hopes to transform a childhood comfort classic into a show stopping dessert. Dan also takes a trip to meet Dr Ben Clarke who was working in the Royal London Hospital A&E during the London Bridge terror attack.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they serve their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Banquet champion Selin Kiazim, a rising star of the London scene renowned for her Turkish Cypriot fusion flavours, is back hoping to join the elite group of chefs who have made it to the banquet twice. She is up against James Cochran who's worked at some of London's toughest kitchens including 2 Michelin starred `The Ledbury' and Scott Goss from `The Twenty Six' in Tunbridge Wells, renowned for his use of local Kent ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs do battle for the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen is tense. Lobster is catch of the day for James whose dish is Caribbean-inspired. Scott is attempting to elevate a classic fish pie, dedicated to his mum who worked as a pharmacist in the NHS for 23 years. And Selin is taking a risk with a complex three-part fish dish featuring sardines, scallops and langoustines, as a nod to the purported health benefits of a Mediterranean diet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scott is showcasing rare-breed Tamworth pork to say thank you to the rare breed of people who work for the NHS. Selin is serving a complex duck dish using ingredients from all around the world to honour `Our Global NHS'. And James is presenting five cuts of goat cooked in five different ways, for his bold dish `Under The Knife'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Selin puts her own unique twist on tea and toast. James creates a decadent coconut parfait accompanied by mango puree filled doughnuts for his dessert `Tree of Life' inspired by the coconut palm tree, the NHS and both of their contributions to our health. Scott hopes his elevated gypsy tart `Honey Bee Good' will secure him a place in the final.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the south east chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they remake their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Vying to be crowned champion of Scotland are three newcomers to the GBM kitchen. Lorna McNee is a former Scottish Chef of the Year and is renowned for her technical precision, gained from working at two-Michelin-starred restaurant `Andrew Fairlie'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the chefs are all out to impress. The heat is increased as all three serve their unique takes on lobster. Ross seeks victory with his dish `Lobster Aid'. Lorna's `Live Well, Live Very Well' features only three elements.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ross is hoping to impress with `Oh Deer It's Time For Your Penicillin', his tribute to Scottish scientist Alexander Fleming featuring an unusual yeast element as well as venison. Across the kitchen, Lorna, a former Game Chef of the Year, is also cooking venison in a bid to impress.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ross is attempting to elevate a classic into a dish worthy of the banquet, Lorna is cooking a personal tribute to NHS staff using unusual yuzu and tonka bean flavours, and Ben is serving an experimental dish which includes a bees wax ice cream.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is judging day and the two remaining chefs must impress the panel of Oliver Peyton, Andi Oliver and Matthew Fort. Both chefs are gunning for success and are doing everything they can to deliver their menus to perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs compete in the heat for the central region. Returner Ryan Simson-Trotman, who failed to reach the national finals last year, is originally from Nuneaton and opened his own restaurant Orwells in the Oxfordshire countryside with his partner Liam, who is also a contestant in the North West region.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the chefs are pulling out all the stops. Marianne pays tribute to the `angels' in her local hospital who looked after her during a recent illness, and Ryan's dish is a reference to the purported health benefits of fish high in omega 3 oils, while Sabrina is inspired by her aunt, a retired nurse who used to take in food to share with her fellow workers during her shifts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their mains and, following the previous day's results, tension is high. Both Marianne and Ryan are cooking muntjac in the hope of impressing the veteran judge, while Sabrina is making an ambitious technical take on a family feast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With one dish left to impress the veteran judge, the chefs cook their desserts. Marianne is looking to raise a smile with her `carry on' themed dessert, complete with surprise presentation. Sabrina hopes to make it through with an elevated take on jelly and ice cream while Ryan goes all out with his very sweet treat `A Spoonful of Sugar'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining central region chefs do battle for a place in the national finals. They must impress the formidable panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton with their four-course menus.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew is attempting to pay tribute to NHS staff with his take on a traditional healing recipe, `Mum's Flu-Fighting Chicken Soup'. Jason's `A Tea From The Heart' is a play on a post-war remedy which harks back to the era when the NHS was formed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After the starter results, the chefs return to the kitchen hoping for high scores with their fish dishes. Chris once again is using ingredients he has foraged from around his restaurant, while Jason hopes to impress with a spicy scallop dish and Andrew prepares a cod dish with 11 different elements.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are pulling out all the stops in a bid for big scores with their mains. All three dishes pay tribute to the founder of the NHS Aneurin Bevan, Chris's `Everything But The Squeal' is an ambitious pork sharing platter, while Jason's `For The Rich And The Poor' showcases lamb, and Andrew is hoping to impress with `Aneurin Bevan For Better Steak'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the dessert course and the last opportunity for the chefs to impress. Chris is hoping to triumph with another dish which showcases the foraged ingredients available around his restaurant, while Jason attempts a technical feat in his dessert inspired by a childhood hospital stay and Andrew is inspired by a dish by his great grandmother used to cook. Which two will make it through to the judging chamber?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Wales regional final as the two remaining chefs do everything they can to impress the judging panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. After tensions ran high in the week, the chefs are under pressure to deliver perfection. The judges are joined by Aneira Thomas, the first baby born on the NHS, who is named in tribute to the service's founder Aneurin Bevan and who went on to dedicate her life to the service. Who will win a place in the national finals?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of three chefs representing the south west, including two who have competed before but meet in the kitchen this week for the very first time. The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their celebratory starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and with Tom renowned as a fish specialist all eyes are on him. He's cooking his take on a classic British fish supper in tribute to a charity which looks after the health of local fishermen. Jude is attempting a complex fusion dish featuring four different fish and an unusual X Ray themed presentation, while Olivia is paying tribute to the staff who looked after her during the birth of her first son with her take on curried monkfish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the main course and two of the chefs are hoping duck will win the day. Tom is preparing a technically challenging duck dish steeped in NHS history while Jude is making a multi-element Chinese duck dish inspired by his mum. Olivia is hoping her dish, using two unusual cuts of beef, will score top points. Olivia also visits her local children's hospital, home of the second busiest paediatric A&E in the country.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With just one more chance to impress their veteran judge, the chefs are all hoping to use their pastry skills to deliver technically complex desserts. Tom's cooking an `Invalid Fruit Tart' inspired by a 1950s recipe, while Jude is making six different apple elements for his `An Apple A Day'. Olivia is using stout in reference to an outdated old wives' tale which suggested the drink was a healthy source of iron during pregnancy.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's time for the two remaining chefs representing the South West to go head to head as they cook their menus again for the exacting panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. With a spot in the National Finals at stake, both are aiming for perfection as they bid for glory. The judges are joined by Barbara Childs, a Matron in the Cardiac Intensive Care Unit at Great Ormond Street Hospital, who isn't afraid to speak her mind in the chamber.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs take to the kitchen in a bid to represent the north west in the national final. They include Ellis Barrie, from the award winning Marram Grass in Anglesey, Liam Simpson-Trotman, an accomplished pastry chef and co-owner of the 4 AA rosette Orwell's in Oxfordshire, and Craig Sherrington, who sharpened his skills working under top names including Eric Chavot and is now Chef Patron of Virginia House in Cumbria.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and the chefs are all gunning for tens. Craig pays tribute to a friend who has revolutionised hospital food in Morecambe Bay, while Liam is inspired by health advice his grandma gave him and Ellis is dedicating his dish to the staff who delivered his son Albert. With cod, mackerel, shrimp and cockles on the menu, which of the chefs will score highly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Time for the chefs to cook their mains and the pressure is on. Craig is hoping to impress using two cuts of Dexter beef, while Liam prepares his take on a Bajan lamb stew and Ellis prepares four cuts of suckling pig. Liam meets his personal hero, Nola Ishmael OBE, who became the UK's first ever black Director of Nursing.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the North West chefs to impress in a bid to make it through to the regional final. Liam is cooking `Not So Hot Toddy' in honour of a friend who works nightshifts in the NHS, while Ellis' `Worth Their Weight in Gold' is dedicated to the staff who saved his brother's life and Craig's dish `The Missed Celebration' pays tribute to his wife with an unusual Christmas concept.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the week return to cook their menus again. Judging them are Matthew Fort, Oliver Peyton and Andi Oliver who are joined by Dr Jake Dunning MBE, an infectious disease specialist who has been recognised for his work during the West Africa Ebola epidemic.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs are doing battle to represent Northern Ireland. Tommy Heaney, Head Chef at the Great House Hotel in South Wales is taken on by Shauna Froydenlund, Chef Patron at Marcus Wareing's two Michelin starred restaurant and James Devine, the 2017 National Chef of the Year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course, the chefs return to the kitchen to cook their fish dishes. James is making his elevated take on a fried chicken takeaway as a tribute to the NHS staff who care for his sister. Shauna is also taking inspiration from a personal connection with a tribute to staff from a facility in her hometown of Londonderry. Tommy is hoping to impress with a dish dedicated to the discovery of DNA.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With two courses down it's time for the chefs to cook their main courses. It's the battle of beef with each using the same meat in their innovative creations. Tommy also meets the first baby ever born on the NHS.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the final chance for the chefs to impress. After such a tightly fought battle all week, each is hoping to deliver a technically perfect dessert. Tommy and James are both using passion fruit in their complex dishes while Shauna is hoping to use her pastry chef training to score full marks.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs representing Northern Ireland go head to head. Judging as ever are Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver who are joined by Shehan Hettiaratchy, lead trauma surgeon at St Mary's Hospital who helped treat victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winning chefs from all eight regions must battle it out for the honour of a spot on 2018's `Feast To Say Thank You' banquet menu, celebrating 70 years of the NHS, one of Britain's most prized institutions.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but after some exceptionally high-scoring dishes in the starter round, everyone is desperate to deliver perfection. Once again the chefs present their innovative, witty or heart-warming creations.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. Both chefs and judges alike are amazed at the high standard of cooking and an incredible number of 10s are dished out as the chefs serve up venison, rabbit, duck, beef, lamb and pork for scrutiny.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and with just one place remaining at the banquet feast, each chef is giving everything they've got for a chance to say thank you to the heroic NHS staff. All the chefs have significantly re-worked or re-invented their desserts since the regional heats, proving that they'll do everything they can in a bid for that final winning spot.
